title: Quiz 1 - Statement - Cause And Effect
instruction: Directions: Each of the following items asks you to pick up the hidden premises (assumptions) of an argument. Mark the best answer.Philosophy should be taught to students at a very early age. It will instil in them a healthy scepticism towards values that they might otherwise accept without question.

quiz.text: Event A: There is a lot of political uncertainty in the country. Event B: The country faces its worst economic crisis of the decade.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: Reliance Multiferrous Ltd. has come out with very good financial results this year.Event B: Last year, Mr. Dhirubhai Lalwani, the CEO of Reliance, resigned.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: People in north Bihar take bath early in the morning even if it is very cold.Event B: In North Bihar, cleanliness is valued more than in the rest of the India.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: Young people in the colleges watch a lot of MTV and rock videos.Event B: Drug addiction is a big problem with our college-going generation.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: People of Taslimganj eat a lot of fruits and vegetables.Event B: It has been noticed that the people of Taslimganj have less hypertension and related problems then the rest of the Indian.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: Major Dayal was educated in one of the best educational institutions of India.Event B: Major Dayal has extremely fluent speaking power.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: The Indian Vikas Party promised to bring in a corruption-free government.Event B: The Indian Vikas party won the elections with a thumping margin.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: The US crushed Iraq in the gulf war.Event B: The US had almost total international support in the gulf war.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: India won the world cup cricket in 1983 despite being the underdogs. Event B: Kapil Dev and Roger Binny played very well in the 1983 world cup.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: Cogentrix Power Project proposal has been rejected by the Govt. of India.Event B: Moody’s has downgraded India’s credit rating.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Statement (A): Government has tightened security checks at all important places and also at various public places.Statement (B): Incidences of terrorist attacks are increasing day by day.
options: if statement (A) is the cause and statement (B) is its effect.
if statement (B) is the cause and statement (A) is its effect.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are independent causes.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are effects of independent causes.
if both the statement (A) and (B) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statement (A): The high court has fixed a time limit for repairing all the roads in the city. Statement (B): Road development authorities in the city are carrying out road repair work on an urgent basis.
options: if statement (A) is the cause and statement (B) is its effect.
if statement (B) is the cause and statement (A) is its effect.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are independent causes.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are effects of independent causes.
if both the statement (A) and (B) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statement (A): The Govt has decided to increase the prices of LPG cylinders with immediate effect. Statement (B): The Govt has decided to increase the prices of kerosene with immediate effect.
options: if statement (A) is the cause and statement (B) is its effect.
if statement (B) is the cause and statement (A) is its effect.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are independent causes.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are effects of independent causes.
if both the statement (A) and (B) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statement (A): The municipal authority demolished the tea stall located on the footpath on the busy road.Statement (B): A large number of people have been taking their evening tea at the tea stall located on the footpath on the main road, blocking pedestrian movement.
options: if statement (A) is the cause and statement (B) is its effect.
if statement (B) is the cause and statement (A) is its effect.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are independent causes.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are effects of independent causes.
if both the statement (A) and (B) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Statement (A): The government has decided to take strict action against the builder responsible for construction of the bridge for having used low-quality material, thereby risking several lives.Statement (B): The government has decided to build a vehicular bridge over the river.
options: if statement (A) is the cause and statement (B) is its effect.
if statement (B) is the cause and statement (A) is its effect.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are independent causes.
if both the statements (A) and (B) are effects of independent causes.
if both the statement (A) and (B) are effects of some common cause.

quiz.text: Event A: Annual production of leather goods (for which this city is famous) is going to drop.Event B: Curfew has been declared in the city.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: PT Usha has been awarded the Arjuna Award for excellence in Sports.Event B: PT Usha is very dedicated athlete.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: Ramesh succeeded.Event B: Ramesh worked hard.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Event A: Modigurard brand of cosmetics does not sell much.Event B: Modiguard brand of cosmetics is poorly advertised.
options: If ‘A’ is the effect and ‘B’ is its immediate and principal cause
If ‘A’ is the immediate and principal cause and ‘B’ is its effect
If ‘A’ is an effect but ‘B’ is not its immediate and principal cause
If ‘B’ is an effect but ‘A’ is not its immediate and principal cause
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is an assumption underlying the argument above?
options: The placement of burial sites near ancient settlements indicates a feeling of piety towards the dead.
Belief in life after death is a central tenet of most religious faiths.
The remains of tools and clothing found in the burial sites had belonged to those buried nearby.
Religious belief is a characteristic of the most civilised societies.
Only those people who believe in life after death would bury articacts.

quiz.text: Which of the following is implied by the passage above?
options: Humorous commercial tend to reduce the credibility of products in the eyes of viewers.
Though enjoyable, humorous commercials are often less memorable than serious commercials.
The most important criterion of a successful advertisement is its ability to increase product sales.
Humorous commercials may alienate almost as many viewers as they entertain.
The ultimate goal of advertising is to increase the name recognition of the product being promoted.

quiz.text: The logical structure of the passage above depends upon the author’s assumption that the expression of lasting moral value is
options: a strictly religious function
no longer deeply valued
essentially non-political
reserved for secular society
the most important role of a religion.

quiz.text: The passage above makes which of the following assumptions? I. It is possible to assign an accurate numerical score to each of the city’s amenities. II. Each of the ten qualities of a liveable city is equally important. III. Most people enjoy some degree of personal choice in where they reside.
options: I only
II only
III only
I and II only
II and III only

quiz.text: An underlying assumption of the passage is that
options: During prohibition, drinking of alcohol was commonly accepted among most Americans.
As long as drugs are available, they will be abused despite laws for the contrary.
Most Americans consider heroin and cocaine to be in the same category as alcohol.
In a democracy, laws must be based on the fundamental beliefs and values of majority of citizens.
Americans popular opinion has always been moulded primarily by the values of the middle class.

quiz.text: The argument above makes which of the following asusmptions? I. Unless students are exposed to philosophy at an early age, they will accept every idea.II. Even at an early age, students are able to understand some philosophical concepts. III. It is a good idea for students to question traditional values.
options: II only
III only
I and II only
II and III only
I, II and III
